form_info:
This is a container for a batch enrichment pipeline that will transform incoming objects before writing them into the bucket output.

It has no attributes of its own - instead expand it using the icon and then add the desired attributes from those available.

templateOptions.label: Allowed external output paths
templateOptions.placeholder: Comma-separated list of paths/globs to which the bucket is allowed to 'externalEmit'

post_building_function.$fn:
function(errs, template, curr_obj, all_templates, root_obj, hierarchy, rows, cols) {
}

form_info:
This is a container for a streaming enrichment engine that will transform incoming objects before writing them into the bucket output.

It has no attributes of its own - instead expand it using the icon and then add the desired attributes from those available.

templateOptions.label: Allowed external output paths
templateOptions.placeholder: Comma-separated list of paths/globs to which the bucket is allowed to 'externalEmit'

building_function.$fn:
function(errs, template, curr_obj, all_templates, root_obj, hierarchy, rows, cols) { curr_obj.external_emit_paths = a2_optional_array_from_csv(template.element.form_model.external_emit_paths);
 curr_obj.master_enrichment_type = 'streaming'; curr_obj.streaming_enrichment_topology = {}; return curr_obj.streaming_enrichment_topology; }

post_building_function.$fn:
function(errs, template, curr_obj, all_templates, root_obj, hierarchy, rows, cols) {
  
}

form_info: General bucket parameters

templateOptions.label: Bucket Path
templateOptions.placeholder: The virtual bucket path, eg /path/to/bucket

templateOptions.label: Poll Frequency
templateOptions.placeholder: Human readable frequency (eg '10min', '1 day') for how often this harvester is polled

templateOptions.label: Requested Data Objects
templateOptions.placeholder: The desired number of data objects to be returned by the test

templateOptions.label: Max Startup Time (s)
templateOptions.placeholder: The maximum number of seconds to wait for the test to startup

templateOptions.label: Max Run Time (s)
templateOptions.placeholder: The maximum number of seconds to wait for the test to run, after it has started up

templateOptions.label: Max Test Storage Time (s)
templateOptions.placeholder: The maximum time (secs) to keep the test result data

post_building_function.$fn:
function(errs, template, curr_obj, all_templates, root_obj, hierarchy, rows, cols) {
  
}

form_info: For advanced users: create an empty Harvester Config that users can build with the form; and configure by writing raw JSON

templateOptions.label: Technology Library Name
templateOptions.placeholder: The path to the technology, eg /app/aleph2/library/harvester.jar

templateOptions.label: Technology Module Name
templateOptions.placeholder: For harvesters with pluggable modules, the path to the module, eg /app/aleph2/library/harvester_module.jar

templateOptions.label: Entry Point Override
templateOptions.placeholder: For harvest modules with multiple entry points, specifies the JVM class to execute, eg com.ikanow.aleph2.harvest.module.Module1EntryPoint

templateOptions.label: Technology Module Name
templateOptions.placeholder: For harvesters that need additional library modules, the path to the module, eg /app/aleph2/library/harvester_module.jar

templateOptions.label: Node rules
templateOptions.placeholder: Comma-separated list of rules determining on which nodes this harvester will run

templateOptions.label: Lock harvester to the same node/set of nodes (recommend leave as true)

post_building_function.$fn:
function(errs, template, curr_obj, all_templates, root_obj, hierarchy, rows, cols) {
  
}

form_info: A streaming or batch analytic job that performs processing on input or stored data.

templateOptions.label: Unique Job Name
templateOptions.placeholder: A Short Name For This Element (Alphanumeric/_ only, no spaces - used for dependencies etc)

templateOptions.label: Dependencies
templateOptions.placeholder: A comma-separated list of dependencies on other analytic jobs

templateOptions.label: Technology Library Name
templateOptions.placeholder: The path to the technology, eg /app/aleph2/library/analytic_technology.jar

templateOptions.label: Technology Module Name
templateOptions.placeholder: For analytic technologies with pluggable modules, the path to the module, eg /app/aleph2/library/harvester_module.jar

templateOptions.label: Entry Point Override
templateOptions.placeholder: For analytics modules with multiple entry points, specifies the JVM class to execute, eg com.ikanow.aleph2.harvest.module.Module1EntryPoint

templateOptions.label: Technology Module Name
templateOptions.placeholder: For analytics that need additional library modules, the path to the module, eg /app/aleph2/library/analytic_module_lib.jar

templateOptions.label: Node rules
templateOptions.placeholder: Comma-separated list of rules determining on which nodes this analytic job will run

templateOptions.label: Lock analytic job to the same node/set of nodes (recommend leave as false)

form_info: A batch analytic job that uses the batch enrichment engine to perform processing on input or stored data.

templateOptions.placeholder: Comma-separated list of rules determining on which nodes this analytic job will run

form_info: For advanced users: create an empty trigger JSON object that can be Raw JSON to provide the desired functionality

templateOptions.label: Trigger Check Schedule
templateOptions.placeholder: Human readable frequency (eg '10min', '1 day') for how often this harvester is polled

building_function.$fn: function(errs, template, curr_obj, all_templates, root_obj, hierarchy, rows, cols) { curr_obj.trigger_config = JSON.parse(template.element.form_model.trigger || '{}'); var pf = template.element.form_model.schedule; curr_obj.trigger_config.schedule = (pf || '').length > 0 ? pf : undefined; }

form_info: Configures the document service (supporting deduplication)

options.name: Overwrite with newer objects, else leave
Merge newer incoming and existing objects

templateOptions.placeholder: The list of fields over which to deduplicate
A list of bucket paths/globs to which to apply the deduplication

templateOptions.label: Finalize all object sets with custom enrichment step, singletons and duplicates
templateOptions.placeholder: If true (default: false) then all objects are run through the custom dedup (ie acting as a "finalize" step before emitting when there is no matching dedup)

templateOptions.label: Delete unhandled duplicates?
templateOptions.placeholder: If true (default: false unless "custom policy" is "very strict") then all existing duplicates that are not explicitly re-emitted are deleted. In non-custom mode, this ensures that only one object per set of deduplication fields is retained.

templateOptions.label: Allow manual deletion?
templateOptions.placeholder: If true (default: false) then user code can delete objects from custom merge code

post_building_function.$fn:
function(errs, template, curr_obj, all_templates, root_obj, hierarchy, rows, cols) {
  
}

form_info: An enrichment engine providing deduplication and lookup functionality

templateOptions.label: Unique Element Name
templateOptions.placeholder: A Short Name For This Enrichment Element (Alphanumeric/_ only, no spaces - used for dependencies etc)
A list of enrichment jobs/inputs that must be completed before this one is run ("$previous" to follow on from the last, [] to listen for all inputs)
The incoming input from this jobs dependencies is grouped according to these fields ("?" for code-generated)

display_name: Global Raw JSON Batch Technology Override
form_info: Applies the raw technology output to all the batch pipeline elements. Should be at the end of the list of batch elements to process.

templateOptions.label: Output mode
templateOptions.placeholder: Default (""/"$$internal") is emit to next bucket, "$$stop" to discard, bucket path to external emit, or $<field> to take option from object <field>
